title: A New Leader for the Arts Center
summary: The Trump-Kennedy Center, a famous arts place, has a new leader named Richard Grenell. He was chosen by President Trump. Some artists are canceling shows because they don't like the changes, like the new name. Grenell says the center is doing well with money now. He explains that before, the center used savings to pay workers, which is not good. Now, with President Trump's help, they have more money from tickets, donors, and companies. Grenell thinks reporters should talk more about the money side instead of just the artists leaving. He wants people to see the full story of how arts places can be successful.

background_read: The Kennedy Center is a big arts center in the U.S. that hosts music, dance, and theater. Recently, it was renamed the Trump-Kennedy Center after President Trump appointed a new board and leader. Some artists are unhappy with this change and have canceled performances. Richard Grenell, the new president, says the center is now financially stable with help from President Trump, unlike before when it used savings to pay workers. This story shows how politics can affect arts institutions and their money.
